meanings.definition: Make or become bigger or more extensive.
meanings.sent1: She is enlarging the photo to see the details better.
meanings.sent2: The company is enlarging its product line to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: He kept enlarging the map until it covered the entire wall!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an enlarging ray of sunshine in the room.
meanings.sent5: The balloon kept enlarging until it popped with a loud bang.

meanings.sent1: The baker is enlarging the cake for the party.
meanings.sent2: The city is enlarging its boundaries to accommodate more residents.
meanings.sent3: The cat was enlarging itself to look bigger in front of the dog.
meanings.sent4: His laughter seemed to be enlarging with each joke he told.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds were enlarging ominously in the sky.

meanings.definition: To make larger in size or scope.
meanings.sent1: They are enlarging their business by opening new branches.
meanings.sent2: The architect is enlarging the building to add more rooms.
meanings.sent3: The magician was enlarging his hat to fit more rabbits inside.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was enlarging with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The garden was enlarging its beauty with every bloom.
